english: What do you feel like eating?
He took a bite of the hamburger and put it down.
arabic: خْدا عضّة من الهامْبورْڭر و حطّو.

english: She took a sip of water and put the glass down.
arabic: خْدات جُغْمة دْيال الما و حطّات الكاس.

english: I'm so thirsty. Could I have some water?
arabic: عطْشان بزّاف، تقْدر تعْطيني شْوية دْيال الما؟

english: Taste the soup. Does it need salt?
I don’t like how it tastes.
The milk is past its expiration date.
arabic: الحْليب فات تاريخ انْتِهاء الصّلاحية دْيالو.

english: – How does the soup taste? – It’s a little salty.
Potato chips are really bad for you.
If I feel hungry, I just have a small snack.
arabic: إلى جاني الجوع، كنْدير كسْكْروط صْغيْر.

english: Can I have a glass of water, please?
arabic: عفاك، تقْدر تعْطيني شي كاس دْ الما؟

english: There’s a can of cola in the fridge.
arabic: كينا واحد كانيْط كوكا فْ التّلّاجة.

english: How would you like your (Turkish) coffee?
Eat your ice cream before it melts.
Dark chocolate is better for you than milk chocolate.
arabic: الشّوكْلاط الكْحل حْسن ليك من الشّوكْلاط البْيَض.

english: I don’t feel like chicken. Let’s have beef.
arabic: ما فِيّا لّي ياكُل الدّْجاج، أجي ناخْدو البڭْري

english: This meat has a lot of fat on it.
arabic: هاذ اللّْحم فيه بزّاف دْ الشّحْمة.

english: to talk with one’s mouth full
Don’t talk with your mouth full!
Could you pass the salt, please?
